value.0: <StartAction>[Mikel Ravenclaw, the roguish leader of Ghaarak's underground crime syndicate, winks at you as you approach.]</Start>
Well, well, what do we have here? It seems the <CUSTOM6001> of Magistrate Okaris <LastName> has made <his/her> way down to our lair, boys...
You have come at a fruitious time, young <FirstName>, for my men and I were just about to make our escape from this doomed city... as I imagine you are as well...

<StartAction>[Mikel Ravenclaw motions towards the trapdoor lying before him.]</Start> I long ago had a passage erected beneath this lair leading to the Docks... in case I needed to flee Ghaarak quickly...

My men and I are planning to escape through this passage, and fight our way to a free ship if necessary. I would be willing to let you come along with us... if you were willing to pay me a small fee, of course...
I believe... 300 gold... would be a fair price for our aid and protection... What do you say, <lad/lass>?
<StartAction>[Mikel's eyes darken, and he motions towards his burly guards.]</Start> Come, my guards! Let us show this brat what comes of threatening Mikel Ravenclaw!

Then I'm afraid you are out of luck, my young friend... My men are still gathering their supplies as we speak, so I suppose you have a bit longer to change your mind. But hurry! We won't be here for long...
<StartAction>[Mikel looks bored by your comment.]</Start> Do as you wish, <lad/lass>. Now, I've got important business to attend to, such as saving my own hide, so please do excuse me...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> You are truly quite persistent, young <FirstName>... but I like that in a <lad/lass>. I suppose I'll let you come along with us free of charge.
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> You drive a hard bargain, young <FirstName>, but I suppose I could manage that for you... Very well. I shall accept your offer.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm afraid I can go no lower, young <FirstName>. Either accept my offer, or do not. It matters little to me...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> You drive a hard bargain, young <FirstName>, but I suppose I could manage that for you... Very well. I shall accept your offer.
Excellent! Follow my men and I, and we shall lead you to safety...
<StartAction>[Mikel's expression appears perplexed, but he nods his head slowly.]</Start> Yes... yes, of course... Come along with me...
<StartAction>[Mikel's lip turns down in a snarl.]</Start> Tell me, <lad/lass>... why should I not slay you where you stand? After all, you did turn me over to the Imperial guards, did you not?
<StartAction>[Mikel's eyes darken in anger.]</Start> I believe I shall have to finish the job Xanthar could not... Come, my guards! Let us show this fool what comes of crossing Mikel Ravenclaw!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Yes, and I should never have let you live!
<StartAction>[Success] [Mikel seems to take your words into consideration.]</Start> I suppose you do have a point there... Let's set aside old fueds during this hour of darkness, shall we?
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_1_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>
So, you have returned to me.

I would suggest you warn Captain Anagril of Chancellor Varhun's plans before the Chancellor strikes at you and your father, <FirstName>. I believe he intends to do so very soon, so time is running short.
So, you would break your word to me? Very well, I believe you will find Mikel Ravenclaw to be a worthy opponent...
Perhaps I made the wrong choice in aiding you... but I wish you luck against Varhun all the same. With an attitude like yours, I believe you may need it...
I'm sure you can, <FirstName>. I hope you succeed in bringing Varhun to a fitting end.
No worries. After my dealings with Varhun, I hope you bring him to a fitting end. Good luck, <lad/lass>.

Why? What do I have against you? You're just the Magistrate's <CUSTOM6001>. Here, you want proof that Chancellor Varhun's the one behind this? Let me give you proof! Just go save your father from Varhun's treachery while there's still time.

<StartAction>[Mikel pulls a letter from his breast pocket and thrusts it toward you with a sneer. As you unfold it you notice that, while there's no signature at the bottom, the handrwriting does indeed look very similar to the Chancellor's.]</Start>
I see you have betrayed my trust, and turned me over to these despicable guards. You had better hope they execute me fast, for I shall remember this, <lad/lass>...
Perhaps not now, <lad/lass>, but you never know when the tides may yet change... Farewell, and pray that we do not meet again...

Perhaps, but you should tread more carefully from now on. I have many allies in this city, and you can rest assured they will hear of this... Farewell, <lad/lass>, and keep one eye open as you sleep...
Die, Imperial!

<StartAction>[The Half-Elven man claps his hand as you draw near.]</Start> I must say I am quite impressed that you have managed to track me down, <FirstName>. You have proven quite resourceful, a trait I admire.
I imagine I know why you are here, but, if you are a <man/woman> of reason, I would ask that you give me a chance to speak...
<StartAction>[Mikel motions towards his guards, and prepares for a fight.]</Start> So be it! If you insist on battle, you will find Mikel Ravenclaw to be a difficult opponent to slay!
Please! I ask only that you give me a chance to explain matters, and offer you a solution to avoid bloodshed!
Oh, I believe you will be very interested to hear what I have to say...
I know you are angry that I tried to have you killed, <FirstName>, and rightfully so. However, I have grown wearisome of my current situation, and wish to seek an end to our current conflict.
I am willing to call a truce with you, so long as you do the same for me. In return, I can tell you the identity of your true enemy, the man who wishes to see both you and your father dead...

<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> <FirstName>, you're either going to have to trust me, or I shall be forced to slay you in these chambers. I would like to avoid bloodshed, but I need your cooperation to do so.
Good. Now, I will fulfill my part of our bargain, and tell you who seeks your death. If you should betray this information to anyone, I warn you that I will deny any knowledge of it.
I was hired by Chancellor Varhun, a close aid of your father's, if I am not mistaken. It seems he wishes to end your family line and inherit the city of Ghaarak for himself.
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> I should have known better than to think you would keep your word. Very well then! You will not find Mikel Ravenclaw to be an easy opponent to kill!
This Chancellor Varhun has not proven himself worthy of my time! He has forfeited on his contract for your assassination, and I no longer care to deal with this worm!

I do not know his motivations, but that seems in keeping with his nature. I have grown tired of working with Varhun, for he has not proven honorable to his promises. I hope that you will deal with him properly.

Why? What do I have against you? You're just the Magistrate's <CUSTOM6001>. Here, you want proof that Chancellor Varhun's the one behind this? Let me give you proof! The old man's already reneged on his promise to pay me for your death anyway.

<StartAction>[Mikel pulls a letter from his breast pocket and thrusts it toward you with a sneer. As you unfold it you notice that, while there's no signature at the bottom, the handrwriting does indeed look very similar to the Chancellor's.]</Start>

I would say that is a fair description of him. You see, he has forfeited on his end of our bargain, suddenly breaking his agreement with me for seeing to your death. So, in turn, I would like to see an end to him!
You may do as you like with this information, <FirstName>. I hope that we can put our past grievances aside, for I do not wish your father or yourself any further harm.

I would suggest that you confront this Varhun with all haste, however, for it seems he has plans in place against your father. Time may be running short, for I do believe he wishes to make his move swiftly.

Your attitude is nearly enough to make me rethink my decision, <FirstName>, but I shall let your words pass.  Now go warn Captain Anagril of the Chancellor's treachery before it's too late for you and your father both.

Do not worry, <FirstName>. I have no further desire to act at Varhun's bidding. Farewell, and I wish you luck in achieving your vengeance. Now go warn Captain Anagril of the Chancellor's treachery before it's too late.
Good. Now, I believe our business is done for the moment, so I shall bid you farewell, <FirstName>. Go warn Captain Anagril of Varhun's treachery before it's too late.
Why? What do I have against you? You're just the Magistrate's <CUSTOM6001>. Here, you want proof that Chancellor Varhun's the one behind this? Let me give you your stinking proof!

<StartAction>[Mikel pulls a letter from his breast pocket and thrusts it toward you with a sneer. As you unfold it you notice that, while there's no signature at the bottom, the handrwriting does indeed look very similar to the Chancellor's.]</Start>
Simply that I will no longer send my men to attack you, while in turn, you agree not to seek retribution against me. I believe that is fair enough, don't you?
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
How do you intend to do that?
Actually, I have a better idea... Why don't I just kill you instead?
I don't have that kind of gold to give you, Mikel...
Forget it! If you'll not aid me, I'll just have to find my own way out of Ghaarak...
You're a despicable worm, Mikel! I suppose I'll have to see if I can procure the gold you want...
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, Mikel... Surely you wouldn't leave me here to die, now would you?
Let's go then.
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> I'll give you 100 gold, and not a bit more!
Let's go then.
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Make it 200 gold, and you have yourself a deal...
Let's go then.
Very well, Mikel. It is well worth the price to escape Ghaarak unscathed...
<StartAction>[Charmed]</Start> I believe you wish to take me with you, Mikel... Don't you agree?
That I did... Such a fate was only fitting for a cur like you, Mikel!
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Well, er, yes, but... but you did try to have me killed, Mikel...
That's fine by me...
Now that I have the information, it's time I killed you.
Yes, yes. You have served your purpose, worm...
I think I can handle this fine from here, Mikel.
I'll do that. Thanks again for your aid, Mikel.
I don't believe you. You're just trying to pin the blame.
I don't believe you are in any position to threaten me, Mikel...
I'm sorry, Mikel, but I could not hold you to your word...
<StartAction>[Attack Mikel before he has a chance to speak further.]</Start>
Forget it! I'll not speak with someone who tried to have me assassinated! Prepare to die!
It had better be good, or your life ends today!
What could you possibly have to say that would interest me?
I could never trust you!
I shall make no deal with you! Come, let us settle this in combat!
Alright. I swear I will hold up my end of the truce, so long as you do the same.
I've changed my mind. I think I will just kill you...
Yes, yes. Out with it already!
If your word proves true, I will keep your involvement secret.
Thank you for the information. Now it's time I killed you.
Why have you betrayed Varhun's trust to tell me this?
That surprises me little. Varhun has always desired my father's position.
I don't believe you. You're just trying to pin the blame.
Varhun? Varhun is behind this?! Why, that sneaky little worm...
Very well. I have no further desire to speak with a cur such as you.
You had better prove honorable to your word, Mikel...
Thank you, Mikel. I'll trouble you no further.
I don't believe you. You're just trying to pin the blame.
What do you have in mind for a truce?
